Module com.example._50zo
Package com.example._50zo.model

Interface IPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Player
public interface IPlayer
Interface representing a generic player in the 50zo card game.

This interface defines the required operations that any type of player (human or machine) must support, including card management and determining whether the player can make a valid move based on the current table total.

Implementing classes must manage their own hand of cards and provide logic to evaluate playable cards according to the game rules.

    • addCard

      Adds a card to the player's hand.
      Parameters:

    • getCardsPlayer

      ArrayList<Card> getCardsPlayer()
      Returns the list of cards currently held by the player.

    • removeCard

      Removes a card from the player's hand at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the card to remove
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid

    • hasPlayableCard

      boolean hasPlayableCard(int currentTotal)
      Determines whether the player has at least one card that can be legally played, given the current total value on the table.

      A card is considered playable if adding its numeric value (according to game rules) to the current table total does not exceed 50.

      Parameters:
      currentTotal - the current accumulated value on the table
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least one valid move, false otherwise
